inn1.comm: length, on middle and off, inside-edged on to his pad and towards square leg. Gul liked that
and he'll like that even more, beating Cook's prod outside off with a delivery that drifted away late
length ball, outside off but swinging back. Cook leaves ... definitely some movement out there for the bowler
quicker, defended off the back foot out towards cover-point
good line, this, from Gul, with Cook playing straight back to the bowler
angled across again and Cook scissors the bat down, the ball squirting away into the off side
wide, swinging further away and Pietersen plays no stroke. Lucky not to be called wide, that
no let-off this time, way outside off and called
boomerangs down the leg side this time, beaten Pietersen's attempted glance, and the keeper's dive, to run all the way to the boundary
again an off-side wide - has Cheema got the yips?
better, still room outside off but at least Pietersen can reach it, stepping across to pat the ball back down the wicket
Pietersen advances again and punches a check drive towards mid-off. KP loves a quick single to get off the mark, doesn't he?
decent length, slanted across the left-hander and Cook shoulders arms
room for Cook to cut but he fails to cash in, chopping the shot into the ground. Maybe tucked up slightly but looked like there should have been runs
wide, slightly short and again cracked into the ground as Cook tries to belt the leather off it. Definitely missed out there
length, outside off and defended on the walk
taken on the rise from outside off, clipped straight to the man at midwicket
tight line, played straight back to the bowler
a beauty from Gul, tempting the batsman forward before seaming back through the gate as Pietersen attempts a loose drive away from his body
on the stumps, flicked off the pads with aplomb down to long leg
lenght, outside off and pushed into the covers
not a bad ball but there's a bit of room outside off and Cook has time to size it up and punch a back-foot drive between mid-off and cover
straighter line and turned to leg
length, on the stumps, back-foot defensive
angled across, pushed out towards point
a bit fuller, Cook tries to drive but the bat turns in his hands and mid-off comes round to field
overpitched on leg stump but Cook's wristy clip flies straight along the ground to the man at midwicket.
on the stumps, turned to square leg, run hard
full length, placed between midwicket and mid-off - well timed
good length from Gul, not quite short enough to pull and Cook misses with a full-blooded attempt
bit more width but well stopped at cover after a powerful drive
back of a length, beaten fishing outside off
angled across, pushed out to cover
on the stumps, Pietersen advances and hits down the ground to long-on. There's a slip and a leg slip in place for KP
flat, on off with not much turn, driven to cover
tossed up more and Cook tries to force the pace again but misses with an airy drive
much better from the batsman, stepping out to steer a straighter delivery between midwicket and mid-on, who is well beaten in the chase to the boundary
length, pushed towards long-on
flatter, quicker and checked back to the bowler by the advancing Pietersen
back of a length, room to cut and Azhar Ali makes a superb diving stop, coming across from cover. Just the kind of thing a bowler likes to see from his team-mates
length ball, played back down the wicket with a straight (well, for Pietersen) bat
slightly full and whipped away with a swing of those stong forearms ... however, it's straight at midwicket and he attempts to throw down the stumps. Pietersen makes his ground
targeting the batsman's body, dropped into the on side
on the walk again, taking a length delivery from outside off and clipping to backward square. Pietersen trying to disrupt Gul's line here
chopped off the back foot towards point by the somewhat-becalmed captain
flat, straight, driven down the ground
fuller, Cook can't get the ball away past the infield
on the pads, turned to midwicket
tossed up and Cook miscues back to the bowler on the bounce
nails it this time, picking up the ball on leg and lofting it to the deep midwicket boundary. Lovely timing
room outside off to drive and Cook again punishes Hafeez with an immaculate drive
short of a length, popped back down on to the wicket on the back foot
wide and slashed over cover - not quite timed but hit hard enough to fly to the rope. Gul holds his head but it wasn't really a chance
another one! On the stumps but overpitched and Pietersen times it down the ground. Two real confidence boosting strokes
short, prodded into the off side
angled in off a good length, slightly miscued pull to short leg
lovely timing again from Cook, showing the virtues of orthodox shot-making. Gul gives him some room outside off - and there's no swing now - Cook driving off the back foot past in front of cover
outside off, squirted to point
on the stumps, turned to square leg
flighted, Cook sweeps aggresively but can't beat the fielder
tossed up again and turned into the gap in front of square
wicket to wicket, almost, defended with a bit stride
tossed towards leg stump and prodded to short midwicket
Flat, quick, left outside off
tossed up and room to cut hard into the off side
on the stumps, defended back
flatter, rolled out with the wrist, pushed into the leg side
again quick and targeting the stumps, Pietersen a little tentative in defence
defended but with the bat angling down. Afridi's looking for the ball to grip a little, like the one that dismissed Pietersen last time. Hasn't found it yet though
tossed up, just outside off, turned towards midwicket
again given some air, Cook gets down to sweep, somewhat awkwardly, behind square leg
lovely shot, skipping out and picking up Rehman on leg stump to chip the ball into the gap where the fielder previously was
flatter, deflected off the pad behind square
on the stumps, Pietersen gets a good stride in and pushes to cover
good length, a little wide but Pietersen can't properly connect with a cut

struck on the pad, lunging half forward - Pakistan go for the review. This could be gone ... Pietersen will only be saved if he's got outside off, or if it's slipping down leg. May have been bat first, also ... Hawk Eye shows the ball only clipping leg and it stays with the umpire's call. KP lives
given a little air, defended on the stumps
another excited appeal from Afridi! Pietersen was struck on the knee roll with the bat not even in the same post code, the ball running to midwicket
defended on the stumps
straight, flat, no turn but Pietersen can't get him away
goes outside off and Pietersen mistimes a cut
dropped slightly short and chopped forcefully through point
comes forward and clips a full delivery to long-on
on the stumps and swept to long leg
quicker ball and Pietersen prods away from his body to gully
on off and defended
maintains that good line and length, Pietersen can't forward, defends into the off side
edged but bounces straight out of Umar Akmal's iron gloves! It was quick, room outside off to cut and just a slight deflection - should have been taken
straighter, turned into the legside
attempts to cut again and misses
driven this time and finds the cover towards deep cover
straighter, defended back to the bowler
on the stumps again and Pietersen strides out to clip down the ground
tossed up and Pietersen steps out, mishitting a lofted drive that falls some way short of long-on, who wasn't all the way back to begin with
flatter, given a bit of a rip but drifting on to Cook's legs, tickled away square

he's gone! Half forward, playing around a straight one - it was the offspinner, but there wasn't much turn and Pietersen went down the Bakerloo (translation: the wrong line). Even he can't bring himself to review that ... Actually, I tell a lie, there was quite a bit of turn there.
given some air and driven towards point
shuffling across the flicked out towards deep backward square
flighted on the stumps and Trott gets forward to smother it
sliding across the batsman and again crashed to the square boundary. Superb placement, Cook looking in ominously good touch again
cut away again to deep backward point
looped up on leg and defended back down the wicket
checked the ball back to the bowler from outside off
bit of room, driven off the back foot into the covers
full, on the stumps and Cook leans over to defend carefully, deliberately
tossed up and defended on the stumps
similar delivery, again played back
dragged shorter, across the batsman, whose eyes bloom wide, chopping a cut shot away to the rope
knocked back past the bowler to long-on
full, on middle and off, defended to midwicket
quicker, on off stump and defended on the front foot
on the stumps, whipped to backward square
full length, on off, driven with a flourish to the man at cover
shorter, on leg stump and shovelled away
the googly and, as in the first match, Trott doesn't pick it, inside edging past his own stumps
played on the front foot, driven through midwicket
outside off, picked up quickly and defended
tossed up, on drive through the infield
full, on off stump, smothered
maintains that line but this time Cook gets him away past mid-off
flighted up, watchfully defended
drifts on to leg and prodded to the man in the midwicket area
again leg side and turned to deep backward square
flicked down to long on
another flick, this time from the left-handed Cook, through midwicket
turn past the outside edge, a fine delivery
flat on leg stump and blocked
short and pulled but only as far as deep square leg, missed out did Trott
leg stump, more air, and nudged through square leg
length outside off and moved with the spin through the leg side
off stump and punched to long off
length on off stump and punched down the ground for another easy single
full on off stump and blocked
Trott back and angles to midwicket
forced away off the back foot through the covers
full on leg stump and driven to long on
outside off and chopped away to deep point
leg stump and pushed away through square leg
picks the length up very early, rocking back and pulling very well over midwicket
forward outside off and a clip to midwicket
leg stump and clipped to short long leg
leg stump and clipped away between backward and square leg in the deep so they trot back for two to Trott
off stump and pushed forward into the off side
length and waited for, cut to cover
skids on to the back pad but going down
length outside off and again cut to cover
off stump, fuller and played back to the bowler, a good set from Rehman
width outside off and cut, parried by point
length on off stump and blocked
Trott steps to leg and looks to open up the off side, cuts to deep cover
length on middle and off and defended
length and worked past the bowler to long on
length on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
swept from outside off between the two deep fieldsman and they come back for two, really well timed from Cook
now a deft late cut past the short third man, races towards the boundary, a good save from Hafeez in the deep
step down and flicked drive to long off
keeps a little low and Cook tucks it to midwicket
tried to be turned with the spin, inside edge onto the pad
this time he gets the flick away through midwicket
full and driven to extra cover
excellent slower ball, Cook picks it late and gets an inside edge into pad, runs out on the off side behind square

got him, poor dismissal. Trott trying to square drive a short ball outside off, he didn't particularly move his feet and got a feather-edge behind to Akmal. None of the family could have shelled that simple chance.
length outside off and Bopara gets in a bit of a mess trying to block outside off, gets beaten on the inside
left outside off
tighter to off stump and left alone at the last moment
outside off and tried to be flicked to leg, a leading edge but away from the fielders for a single towards long off
floated up and driven down the ground to long off
dropped out into the covers
push and go to mid on, run out chance missed, the direct hit would have done the trick
adjusted for the length, flicked to midwicket from the crease
length outside off and pushed to midwicket
full on off stump and turned into the leg side
length on off stump and cracked to mid off
back of a length and bottom edged to long leg
length outside off and guided to third man
tucked to midwicket, a midfield allows them to scamper through hurriedly for a run
driven off a fullish length, it's off a good outside edge but wide of the solitary slip and away for four to third man
tried to be swept from a long way outside off, balloons up off the pad into the off side for a leg bye
off stump and blocked forward back to the bowlers
length on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
length and angled to point
slower and dropped to point
middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
middle and off, forward to push down the ground to long off
length on middle and leg and whipped to deep square
wide of off stump and mistimed back to the bowler
length on off stump and blocked back to the bowler
driven away superbly, nicely timed and placed past extra cover, no man out in the deep there, so four to wide long off
turned away through backward square leg
hit on the pad playing back, a brief cry for lbw by the bowler, going a long way down leg
swept hard by Cook and the spin nearly beats Younis Khan in the deep, a good save in the end
full on leg stump, tucked into the leg side
driven down the ground to long off's left
length outside off and punched to long on
full on middle and punched down the ground once more
turned with the spin to square leg
turned again to the leg side fielders
now driven to long on off a fuller length
a little tucked up, pushes to midwicket
down the leg side, flicked at and missed, wide called
sliding on and pushed to midwicket from the crease
length and Cook stays back outside off stump and swats it down the ground
chopped away from back of a length, chase round for Farhat
length on off stump and clipped to midwicket
leg stump and whipped out to the deep fieldsman
dropped out on the off side off the front foot, wide enough of the fielder to take a single
tucked into the off side, a direct hit from Afridi, Cook was home and overruns so can't take an overthrow that Bopara wanted
full and dropped into the off side off the front foot
full on the pads and pushed past midwicket and they can take two as deep square leg has to come a long way round
middle and leg, dropped into the leg side
tossed up on middle and leg and flicked into the leg side gap between square leg and midwicket
back foot drive to extra cover
short outside off and pulled to long on
tossed up on the stumps and clipped nicely down the ground
on leg, turned squared off the hips
good length, outside off, played with the turn to short third man
drifting in, nurdled away off the back foot towards deep midwicket and the batsmen run hard for two
tickled into the leg side, where there is a man back
on the stumps but nudged softly to short midwicket
beaten by the turn outside off ... Umar drops it anyway. *Shakes head*
on middle and leg, sweetly timed into the gap between deep square leg and wide long-on. Well fielded on the boundary, with a textbook slide and flip to a team-mate
fullish, pushed down the ground to long-on
wide on the crease, wide in the delivery and slapped derisively through point. One or two imprecations from Gul, there, but he only has himself to blame
length, on the stumps, ushered down to long-on
full and wide, slapped hard to point where it's well fielded and quickly returned
a slower yorker, picked up slightly late by Cook but he gets his bat down on it. Thought he was going to be castled there!
cotinuing around the wicket, patted into the leg side ... Bopara drops his bat as he grounds it but there's no danger
a false stroke but it brings the England captain four. He was reaching forward, beaten by the spin and a thickish edge scurried away fine to third man
flighted up, on off but turned round the corner to square leg - expert placement from Cook
length, nurdled square and there's no man to prevent the quick single
pitching outside off, punched to cover
more width and driven square but straight to the fielder
full, straight and driven to long-on
slanted across, clipped off the front foot wide of midwicket, who gets round quickly to prevent a second run
full, deflected down to third man
bosh! That's a confident stroke, taking a full, straight delivery and short-arm jabbing it over midwicket, where it bounces along merrily to the boundary
drops short and Cook rocks back, whipping a flat pull shot out towards deep backward square, who has to come round and field on the slide
full again from Gul but cook angles the face of the bat and rattles a drive to the boundary behind point. He's batting like a luxury saloon right now, a silky smooth ride
tossed up, defended on the stumps
on leg, turned into the space at square leg but they can't quite get back for two
dragged a touch short, thick edged to short third man ... that's enough for them to get through for the single and bring up Cook's second hundred in succession!
beaten outside off by a full, flighted delivery
on leg, pushed to mid-on who tries to catch Cook out backing up - but ends of conceding an overthrow
length, outside off, turned into midwicket area
wide, cut out towards point
flat, no turn but skimming off the surface, defended on the front foot
more room outside off but misconnects with a hook and the ball trundles to mid-on

gone! Afridi held that one back a bit and Cook was a little early on the shot, lobbing the ball off the face straight back to the bowler. Still, that's another captain's knock and he's left England very well set
wide, across the left-hander - possibly the googly too - and Morgan misses with a slash
floated up a little more and defended back
continues around, defended
on the legs and again Bopara can't get him away
wide, cut via the edge of the bat and it runs quickly fine, past short third man. Ajmal looks miffed
bit more air and tucked down to long-on
tossed up, driven to cover
short, Morgan goes back and nudges the ball into the off side
bounces a little, on the stumps and Bopara busily hacks it to deep square
beats the outside edge with the googly. Morgan struggling to read Afridi at the moment
length, goes for the reverse sweep but gets hit on the forearm
angled across and he goes back, cuts to third man ... that gets him off the mark
outside off, punched towards cover
slower, on the legs and miscued aerially through vacant midwicket area
tossed up outside off, defended
clipped to long-off
on the legs, turned into the gap square
defended cautiously on off
flighted, driven back down the ground
drifting down the leg side
and again, turning too far too leg
on the legs and clipped to deep square
attempted cut, not really enough room and the ball just misses the stumps before evading Umar
on the stumps, missed flick and hits the pads
driven out towards point
short and shovelled into the vacant midwicket area for a quick two
outside off, davances and chips over the infield to long-off
shorter, on the stumps, patted out to point
length, wide and cut hard to the fielder at point
slower ball, looping slightly towards leg, chipped down the ground to long-on
cuts his fingers over the ball, Bopara dropping to short of midwicket
full and wide, Morgan flexes those thighs then raps a late cut to the square boundary, where it's fielded on the slide. Sign of some aggression from Morgan?
yes, I think so. There's that exaggerated press again, and he tees off down the ground. It's mishit but long-on has to come in and the throw is poor
good response from Cheema, fizzing it in full and slightly wide, Morgan thunking his drive into the ground
on the legs, swept hard square
tossed up and Morgan does the same, sweeping for one
shorter, maintaining the defensive line to Bopara, who pulls to deep square
makes room and chops the off spinner through point
tossed up on the stumps and though Bopara backs away, he can only squirt it into the ground to cover
advances and goes aerial, flipping the ball wide of long-on, who fields on the bounce
full, towards the blockhole and the bat turns in the hand as he drives to the cover region
attempted slash through the off side but the ball was too full to get under
well outside off, Bopara changes his grip and tries to manufacture a paddle stroke ... the ball hits the pad, though, and trickles to short third man
full again, dug out to midwicket. Cheema's bowling an excellent length here
and again, brilliantly bowled - a slightly wide yorker that Bopara, back in his crease, fails to get his bat on
short this time and the hook is miscued but falls short of deep square leg - that's a second consecutive fifty for R-Bop
tossed up, lbw shout as Bopara swings and misses, the ball rolling square on the leg side
tossed up, driven square
short, Bopara backs away and hacks straight back to the bowler
on the legs and this time driven through extra cover
here we go! Down on one knee, Morgan carts Ajmal well over the deep midwicket boundary. Now, will that light the Irishman's fire?
quicker, chopped back to the bowler
too short and wide and Bopara thwacks an aerial drive that just clears Abdur Rehman's half-hearted jump between mid- and long-off
full, straight, swings hard again but the ball hits Morgan's bat and Cheema nearly effects a run out
full-bunger again, wide of the left-hander, who squeezes it out to point
bumper, wide of off again and hoicked into the space behind midwicket, with deep square unable to get round
an excellent delivery, taking the pace off and Bopara misses with a mighty heave. He yells in frustration and then dives to regain his crease from Umar's throw

an almighty skier, which went pretty much straight up and down, with Umar coming in to take the catch above the stumps. Good comeback from Cheema, who started abysmally today but pulled Pakistan back into it with some excellent death bowling

inn2.comm: full of length and left alone
leg stump, off the pad, it runs to long leg
full, just outside off and left alone
wide and cut away, a fine diving save at cover point by Jonny Bairstow - on the field for Ravi Bopara
full, swinging into middle, worked to mid on
wide and a big swipe brings a big edge down the third man
leg side wide
full and driven to mid on
length and it darts away from the left-hander with good bounce
length and in the corridor outside off, left alone
length sliding past the left-hander again, another fine delivery
middle and leg, worked down wide of long leg, good running brings two
length on middle and off and defended back up the wicket
off stump, full, blocked from the crease
full again on off stump and carefully defended
forced off the back foot past a diving Morgan through the covers
back of a length and dropped to third man
length outside off, a drive and a miss
fuller outside off and blocked to mid off
length that just squares Hafeez up slightly, edged to third man
leg side, off the pad to Kieswetter
full and dug out back to the bowler
full length, strikes the pad and runs into the leg side
full, driven off the outside half of the bat into the covers
full, tight to off stump and well left
full on off stump and dropped into the leg side playing slightly round the line
length on middle and leg, tucked to square leg
length ball and left outside off
length just outside off stump and pushed into the covers
length on off stump and dropped into the off side
length again on off stump and blocked on the crease
back of a length from Anderson and Farhat stands tall and defends on off stump
little bit of width offered, whipped away square, no timed well enough to run for four, just two as Pietersen fields
poor from Anderson, a leg stump half volley and clipped away nicely past Patel at midwicket, no stopping that...not from Patel anyway...(cheap I know...)
back on a length on off stump and blocked back to the bowler
fuller on off stump and dropped on the off side
tucked away off the pads wide of long leg
full on middle stump and pushed to midwicket
back foot punch to mid off
forward and dropped in front of point
length on off stump and pushed into the off side from the crease
played back again into the off side
forward and pushed to third man
a real loosener from Broad, wide half-volley and put away with Ã©lan from Hafeez through extra cover
off stump and length, defended forward
full and driven down to mid off
dropped back to the bowler off the front foot, Hafeez thought it was wide of him so briefly set off for a single and briefly caused panic
lifted off a length over midwicket, nice stroke, well timed and it runs away for four as Patel chases in vain
length and back foot pushed to mid off
full outside off and driven to mid on
more back of a length and cut to point
forward on off stump to block to mid off
fully and dug up into the off side to extra cover
length and driven from just outside off back to the bowler
leg side and wide called
slides past the outside edge as Farhat tries to drive
full and clipped off the pads out to the midwicket boundary, a slide from Patel isn't in time, four more to Hafeez who's finding his touch
length outside off and dropped to short cover point
length and turned into midwicket past the fielder
a drive, pretty well timed, but straight to mid off
length with a hint of width allowing Farhat to cut down to third man
good length on off stump and pushed down to mid off to end the other
turn past the outside edge and an appeal for a stumping but Farhat is back
forward on middle and off, edged through square leg
plays back and there's turn into the batsman, inside edge onto the popping crease
outside off, played forward and blocked
full outside off and clipped down to long on
lifted up and over mid off and it skips away down to the boundary
length on off stump and pushed into the leg side
late cut, dropped towards Morgan at point
opened the face, guided past point in the air down to third man
forward on off stump and dropped into the leg side
cut away out to deep cover point
length on middle and leg, flicked over the square leg umpire out to the man in the deep
full and pushed down to long on
tossed up on off stump and punched to extra cover
played forward, opened the face and it beats the dive of Broad at backward point and races away to the third man fence
driven back towards the bowler from a full length
leg stump and turned into midwicket
length outside off, dabbed to short third man
off stump and tucked to midwicket
length outside off and cut out to deep point
middle stump and worked to deep square
whipped out to deep midwicket
back of a length and pushed down the ground for another single to long on
pulled away down to long leg as Pietersen comes round
Flashed down to long off
attempted paddle sweep, runs off the pad, appeal for leg before, it runs down to long leg
pushed into the off side, in the air for a moment
pushed down the ground to long on
forward and blocked on off stump
turn and it almost stops in the pitch as Farhat tries to turn it away, it loops towards the bowler, falling short of Swann
on the line outside off, defended back to the bowler

the breakthrough England needed! It was a tame dismissal, Hafeez mistiming an on drive straight to Jonathan Trott at midwicket. He took a straightforward catch at head height and Jimmy has his first wicket of the series. No need for assistance from the dew if the batsman are going do that ...
length ball, deflected down to third man
outside off, driven uppishly through cover, with Bairstow doing the chasing
completely loses his line and Ali flicks him from outside leg stump down to the boundary
straighter, length delivery, solid defence
on the stumps, turned into the on side
flat, outside off, chopped to point
similar ball, not a lot of air, and cut hard straight to the fielder
on the stumps, goes back and on-drives for one
tossed up a wee bit more and pushed off the front foot to cover, where the fielder makes a diving stop
on the stumps and this time patted to midwicket. A solid start from Patel
leg-stump line and prodded back to short midwicket
back of a length and turned off the hips, with Kieswetter chasing the ball down at square leg
wide, full, with the fingers rolled over the ball, beating Azhar's dangling bat but also eluding Kieswetter and they run a bye
full and straight but Farhat sees it early and hammers a lofted drive down to long-on for a one-bounce four. Cracking shot
more width and chopped towards point
length, driven wristily square but can't beat point
tossed up, clumped back to the bowler
bit of air outside off, squirts off the edge through cover
leaning forward to take the ball as it bounces outside off and steer it past cover for a couple
room outside off to drive again but superbly fielded on the dive at cover
well outside off, fullish and swept square
on the stumps, poked back to the bowler
short, leg side and an easy call for the umpire
fuller ball, driven from outside off to mid-off
bouncer, well directed and Farhat sways underneath it
length ball, angled across, dabbed to the man at short third man

deflected off the handle, almost and Kieswetter leaps to palm it over the bar. Great save but bit of a rubbish attempted catch - Broad doesn't look pleased at all. Seems like Kieswetter just misjudged it and the ball hit his wrist
leg-side bouncer, born of frustration, you suspect
length, driven to cover
good length, outside off and deflected to short third man
tossed up on off, driven out long-off
on the stumps, driven back past the bowler's dive
leg-stump line, clipped towards midwicket
tossed up and mishit into the ground, back to Patel
again looped up on off and Azhar scoops it into the leg side via his pad
slow, flighted on off and lashed on the drive, only for another diving stop at cover to prevent a run
length ball, slightly wide and angled down to third man

slower ball, lbw appeal ... but with Farhat dawdling halfway down the wicket, Broad swoops on the loose ball and underarms into the stumps! It had struck the left-hander outside leg stump but he seemed distracted by the appeal and Broad was quick to seize the chance. Not that we saw a lot of it, as the cameras focused on Dharmasena shaking his head ...
short, glanced to third man
short, swinging down leg ... too far down leg for the umpire
length ball, off-stump line, defended on the front foot
fired in on leg stump, Azhar misses with a glance and the ball loops into the off side via the pad, with Morgan this close to a direct hit swooping in from point
short, turned wristily to short midwicket off the back foot
angled in, jabbed into the leg side
straight again and turned to short third man
tossed up on the stumps from wide on the crease ... and an appeal, as Younis misses with the sweep. Looked a decent shout but England decide against reviewing
tossed up, driven back and Patel fields on the dive
bit of air, driven back to the bowler again
overpitched and rifled through cover, with Steve Finn making a bit of a hash of his attempted diving save on the boundary, taking the ball over the rope with him
on the stumps, turned tosquare leg for a quick single
outside off, turning in, prodded to short midwicket
tight line still, defended back
tossed up, outside off and Azhar misses on the walk, the ball looping into the off side off the pad
down on one knee this time to paddle over his shoulder
outside off, Younis flicks to long-on with his back leg in the air, flamingo-style

on middle and leg, straightens and hits the pad ... out! Is he going to review? No! Patel's golden arm strikes again - as with Misbah and Malik in the first ODI, there was nothing that special about the delivery but it was on target and Younis played around his pad. Samit has tipped the scales (no sniggering) for England ...
outside off, driven to cover
outside off, length, can't get him away
tossed up, driven to long-off on the walk
full ball, crunched into the ground and out towards the deep cover fielder
same line, punched down the ground to long-off
on off, can't get the drive away
off-stump line, attempts to scoop to leg but can't beat the infield
full ball, played back down the wicket
length, turning back in, jabbed into the leg side
straighter, forward defensive
flighted again and clipped to long-on
on the stumps, nurdled back to the bowler
full length, paddled before the bounce down to fine leg - neat bit of improvisation from Azhar
flatter, quicker and nearly catches Misbah on the back foot
again played off the back foot in front of the stumps towards cover
outside off, squeezed out to point
bit of rip, on the stumps and prodded back

stumping - review time! Misbah didn't properly connect with an attempted flick from outside off and ended up dragging the ball just past his leg stump. Kieswetter then dislodged the bails but Misbah got his foot back in time
tossed up, swept square
outside off, jabbed into the leg side
off-stump line, turned to midwicket
length ball, flicked on the up past cover
full and Misbah works it into a gap on the leg side
short, in the corridor outside off, angled down to third man
short and wide again, partly to counteract Azhar's trigger movement forwards - he opens the face and guides the ball to third man
length, outside off and edged between his legs and again fractionally past the stumps
driven off the back foot but superbly fielded at point by Morgan to prevent a run
short and Misbah under edges a pull on to his body, Kieswetter scurrying to field
length, outside off, driven to point. Very tight over from Anderson, there ... batting is getting a little harder with the old ball
now, that's the way to score on this pitch. Swann tossed it up and Azhar reverse swept, helping the ball on its way past short-third man
looping ball outside off, scooped to short fine leg this time
around the wicket, manhandled through midwicket with the bottom hand
drops a touch short, clipped through cover-point off the back foot
outside off, Misbah hopping about in his crease and fiddled to third man
wicket to wicket, turned to square leg but well fielded and Misbah aborts hit attempt at a run
tight line on the stumps, patted to midwicket
slower, outside off and Misbah mistimes a heave, down on one knee, the ball barely leaving the square
swinging away down the leg side
on off stump but Misbah gets across and glances to deep backward square
slower ball, well outside off and Misbah falls to connect - almost a wide but turned out to be a good delivery
length, outside off, guided to third man running around
on the legs, flicked out to deep square
around the wicket to Misbah, leg stump, turned to square
leg-stump line again, clipped away to deep square
straight, played to cover from around off
outside off, swept to deep backward square
short, nurdled into the gap square on the leg side
tossed up and jabbed to mid-on
decent length, outside off and met with a fierce reverse sweep that gives short third man no chance
tossed up, on off, clipped to midwicket
straigh, defended back to the bowler
full length and again flicked over the batsman's shoulder

misses a straight one and off stump is pegged back! Azhar played back, trying to give himself room to cut through point but it hurried on to him and rattled into the wicket. Samit strikes again! England seize the advantage once again
tossed up, drive out to deep cover
length on off stump and blocked back to the bowler
full and angled down to third man
outside off and cut down to third man
middle and leg runs off the pad behind square
lavishly driven past extra cover out to Broad who goes to his right in the deep
length on middle and off, clipped through midwicket
punched down the ground to long off
driven firmly on a couple of bounces to extra cover
down the pitch and smashed back up the pitch, cannons into the stumps
flicked back to the bowler from leg stump
back and punched down the ground to long on
nibble away from Misbah's forward prod, gets beaten
back foot drive to extra cover
down the pitch and slapped down the ground, a pretty ugly club, but very effective down the ground for four past mid on
back of a length and defended from the crease
length and dropped into the leg side
short and pulled through square leg out to the man in the deep
middle and leg, full, and pushed to midwicket
full and slapped back to the bowler where Finn saves to his left
a hoik into the leg side and it races behind square, a good connection off the front foot
length on off stump and blocked backed up the pitch
down the leg side, bad time for a wide
worked into midwicket off a length
across his stumps to a back of length ball and turned to leg
off stump and blocked forward
turned to leg from outside off
tries to open up the off side, with all the men up there, can only bottom edge a length ball
picked up down the ground, long on comes round to field and prevent four
turns and paddles in the air towards short long leg but it's just short of Patel who slides and saves
short, pulled and missed by Misbah
short again, this time connected with the pull out to square leg

full and striking the pad, runs down to fine leg for four, cry for lbw, not out, referred but it's only umpire's call striking leg stump so it stays not out and more importantly, the four runs stand too
length, forward, pushed into the off side and there's no run to cover
full and driven off an inside edge into the leg side, Finn charges through to field but the batsman scramble a single
oh dear, a wide low, full toss and handsomely put away over cover point. The worst ball Finn's produced in two matches

slapped to cover and caught! A very sharp catch low down by Patel. They went upstairs to check but it looked pretty straightforward that it was a clean catch...certainly Patel was totally convinced he'd caught it. It was a length ball on middle, Akmal gave himself room to cut into the off side and he found the fielder
full and driven to extra cover
full and slapped down to long on, brings Afridi on strike
length and driven to the right of mid off, not wide enough for a run
short of a length outside off and left alone
back of a length again just outside off, this time goes to flick it to third man and misses
another short ball, closer to the body, beats the attempted pull for pace
back of a length outside off, swung at and missed
length just outside off and cut to third man
full and slapped down the ground to mid off who's a bit deeper
forward on off stump and angled to point
guided wide of third man and they can take two
driven with a flourish to cover
back of a length, follows Misbah as he gives himself room, cut to point
it's a chance first ball, lofted drive to long off, it just carried to Broad tumbling in from the boundary but he can't hold it, such a great effort though
calmly tucked down the ground off the back foot
middle and leg, whipped wide of long on so it's two, good cricket
flighted and Afridi down the pitch, yorks himself and runs it back to the bowler
full and whipped away again into the leg side, just a single to deep midwicket
Misbah steps away but then just clips into the leg side and picks up two as the deep fielders can't return quickly enough, more good cricket
back of a length outside off and guided to third man
well bowled, length and it nibbles past the prod from the crease
forward, popped up over the bowler's head as the ball just sticks in the wicket
dropped behind square on the off side, not time to go just yet for Afridi
dropped out to point from the crease
middle and off, turned away through the leg side for a single
leg stump, dropped into the leg side
length, he wasn't to the pitch, but the power of Afridi is such that he still powers it over long on, great shot
four now through extra cover and this was middled, more good footwork
good batting, punched into the leg side for one, the damage is done for now
Misbah carefully forward to push back to the bowler
dug out on the leg side
length and blocked back to the bowler

swing and a miss and Anderson strikes middle and off, that's a pretty miserable end for Afridi, looking to heave into the leg side, missed by a long way. There really was no need for that just yet...he's handed the initiative back to England after a great previous over
length outside off and a poke and miss
another play and miss outside off
once again length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler from the crease
length and cracked to point
width and a fabulous shot, cut past point and away wide of third man for four! The drama continues
guided again behind square but straight to third man this time
length outside off and it reverse swings away from Rehman, beating him again, actually he was miles away
fuller outside off and a swing and a miss, another dot
another play and miss to a length ball outside off
full but this time too wide and called a such
length and Rehman tries to go leg side with a heave and misses by a huge distance
length ball on off stump and blocked
pushed away from back of a length into the off side and they take a run
full and Rehman gets a bat on it to point and they scramble a run
heave to leg, Trott's out there and can field to keep them to only one
fired into the pads, no run back to the bowler...but a no ball! Again silly extras
swing and miss, clatters out middle stump but of course it doesn't count, crucially a dot ball though

full, another swing, back goes the off stump and this time Rehman's torturous innings is ended. He tried another heave to leg and is put out of his misery, missing by miles. That has just eaten up deliveries and potentially handed the game to England

oh what a take! Kieswetter takes an absolute pearler running back behind him to remove Misbah and Pakistan's last hope. Misbah tried to swing a full Broad ball to leg, got a big top edge, it whirled behind the keeper who raced back and was nowhere near it but at the last moment, dived full length to his left to make the grab with both hands. An absolutely fantastic bit of work from Kieswetter and that should win England this game
length outside off and played and missed at
swung outside off and another play and miss
could there be hope yet...a great hit over cow corner, lovely strike, picked up of a length and it blazes to the boundary
another swing, off the toe to third man
full on leg stump, strikes the pad
full, missed, lbw and this game is all but over. A quick, straight delivery is too good for Gul, a great yorker right up there, Gul missed and that would have cannoned leg stump
full and straight, chopped into the covers, the scramble through
a length ball heaved off low on the bat over mid on, they'll get a couple
step across the stumps and a paddle over short long leg brings four, good shot, plenty more of that required for what would be somewhat of a miracle
steps away and cracks a drive to extra cover off a bottom edge
swing and a miss, Cheema bowled and England win by 20 runs. A length ball, a real tailender's swipe across the line and the stumps pinged back
